SEARCH
Package io.github.jnodorp.jiffybox.modules

Schnittstelle ModuleMonitoring

public interface ModuleMonitoring
This interface describes the monitoring module.

  • Methodendetails

    • build

      static ModuleMonitoring build(String baseUrl)
      Build the module.
      Parameter:
      baseUrl - the base URL
      Gibt zurück:
      the module

    • getMonitoringChecks

      Response<Map<String,MonitoringCheck>> getMonitoringChecks()
      With this call you will get an overview of all monitoring checks.
      Gibt zurück:
      The retrieved monitoring checks.

    • getMonitoringCheck

      Response<MonitoringCheck> getMonitoringCheck(int id)
      Provides details of a specific monitoring check. The result is equivalent to a single monitoring check of get().
      Parameter:
      id - Check-ID
      Gibt zurück:
      The retrieved monitoring check.

    • deleteMonitoringCheck

      Response<Boolean> deleteMonitoringCheck(int id)
      With this command you can delete monitoring checks. The command is asynchronous. On success the result is true; false otherwise. A success solely means the deletion was requested successfully. The actual deletion is executed asynchronously. The state of deletion can be obtained by fetching the checks details. As soon as the notice occurs, that the check is unavailable, the deletion is finished. During the deletion the monitoring checks status is set to DELETING / DELETED. In case the status switches back to READY the deletion failed.
      Parameter:
      id - Check-ID
      Gibt zurück:
      If the monitoring check was successfully deleted.

    • createMonitoringCheck

      Response<MonitoringCheck> createMonitoringCheck(MonitoringCheckBuilder data)
      There are two ways to create a new monitoring check: 1. Create a new monitoring check from scratch. 2. Duplicate an existing monitoring check. The creation is an synchronous process. A success as result solely means the creation was started successfully. The result can only be obtained by periodically requesting the according get(id) method. id is contained within the result of the creation. During the creation the monitoring checks state is CREATING. As soon as the monitoring check is set up the status switches to READY. On failure the process is automatically repeated one time. If the creation fails twice the state is switched to ERROR. All parameters defining times are interpreted as seconds. Default values are used when optional parameters are left out. The parameters are handled using an existing MonitoringCheck object since the creation is really complex.
      Parameter:
      data - The MonitoringCheck to create.
      Gibt zurück:
      The created monitoring check.

    • duplicateMonitoringCheck

      Response<MonitoringCheck> duplicateMonitoringCheck(int id, MonitoringCheckBuilder data)
      Duplicating monitoring checks requires the id of the monitoring check as GET parameter. To duplicate a monitoring check at least one parameter has to be changed. The other settings are copied from the original monitoring check. For the parameters please check the post() method. For further documentation please read the official API documentation.
      Parameter:
      id - Check-ID
      data - A monitoring check to use for configuration.
      Gibt zurück:
      The created monitoring check.

    • getStatus

      Response<Map<String,MonitoringStatus>> getStatus(int id)
      Provides the current status of a single monitoring check.
      Parameter:
      id - Check-ID
      Gibt zurück:
      The monitoring checks status.

    • getStatuses

      Response<Map<String,MonitoringStatus>> getStatuses(String address)
      With this call you get the current status of every active monitoring check defined on a given IP address.
      Parameter:
      address - IPv4-address
      Gibt zurück:
      The monitoring checks statuses of the given IP address.
